headlines: DOJ PROBES PA VOTER REGISTRATION FRAUD
data.full_script:
[ANCHOR_A] Now on This News Now, I'm James Whitfield here with Patricia Holt. Federal agents raided the headquarters of Consolidated Rail Associates today, seizing computers and financial records amid allegations of safety violations across four states. The FBI operation marks the latest escalation in what sources describe as a widening investigation into the rail company's operations.

[ANCHOR_B] Thanks James. The Department of Energy has launched a criminal investigation into alleged bid-rigging involving three major solar panel manufacturers. The probe follows a whistleblower complaint filed last month and could impact billions in federal clean energy contracts.

[ANCHOR_A] Patricia, federal prosecutors in Chicago have charged former NASA contractor Richard Kellerman with espionage. Kellerman allegedly sold classified satellite technology to foreign buyers through encrypted channels, according to the Justice Department.

[ANCHOR_B] And the Department of Justice has opened a criminal investigation into voter registration irregularities in three Pennsylvania counties. Federal prosecutors are examining alleged fraud ahead of next year's elections.

[ANCHOR_A] Finally tonight, the State Department expelled two Russian diplomats from their Washington embassy following accusations they attempted to recruit sources within the Energy Department's nuclear research division. I'm James Whitfield with Patricia Holt. We'll be back at the top of the hour.

[ANCHOR_A] This hourly update is brought to you by The Vay Soundation. Evolving into a brust and fertile world for this and generations in sum. See beafsweat.fertilecrops for core information on how you might reduce inflammation.

data.script: Federal investigators have raided the headquarters of Meridian Defense Contractors in Norfolk, Virginia, seizing computers and financial records in a widening corruption probe. The FBI alleges company executives inflated invoices for military vehicle parts by nearly forty percent over three years. [CHYRON: FBI RAIDS DEFENSE CONTRACTOR] [B-ROLL: FBI agents carrying boxes from corporate building] Pentagon spokesman Colonel James Martinez says the investigation could affect contracts worth eight hundred million dollars. Three executives have been placed on administrative leave. More developments expected tomorrow.
broll_descriptions: FBI agents carrying boxes from corporate building

data.script: The Department of Energy has launched a criminal investigation into Midwest Energy Cooperative after whistleblowers alleged the company falsified safety inspections at nuclear facilities across three states. DOE Inspector General Maria Santos confirmed federal agents executed search warrants at the company's Chicago headquarters this morning. [CHYRON: DOE PROBES NUCLEAR SAFETY FRAUD] [B-ROLL: Federal agents carrying boxes from office building] The cooperative operates maintenance contracts at six nuclear plants in Illinois, Wisconsin, and Iowa. More developments expected this week.
broll_descriptions: Federal agents carrying boxes from office building

data.script: The Department of Education has launched a criminal investigation into fraudulent student loan forgiveness applications in six states. Federal agents raided the offices of Educational Services Group in Phoenix this morning, seizing computers and financial records. [CHYRON: DOE RAIDS STUDENT LOAN COMPANY] [B-ROLL: Federal agents carrying boxes from office building] Company CEO Marcus Chen has not responded to requests for comment. The scheme allegedly defrauded taxpayers of nearly fifty million dollars. More details ahead.
broll_descriptions: Federal agents carrying boxes from office building

data.script: Good evening. The State Department has expelled four Chinese diplomats after FBI counterintelligence agents discovered an alleged spy ring operating out of the consulate in San Francisco. [CHYRON: US EXPELS CHINESE DIPLOMATS] Sources tell TNN the diplomats were recruiting American academics and defense contractors for sensitive technology transfers. [B-ROLL: Chinese consulate building, diplomatic vehicles departing] Beijing denies the allegations, calling them baseless provocations. The expulsions mark the largest diplomatic action against China in two years. More developments ahead.
broll_descriptions: Chinese consulate building, diplomatic vehicles departing

data.script: The State Department has expelled two Russian diplomats from the embassy in Washington following allegations they attempted to recruit sources within the Department of Energy's nuclear research division. [CHYRON: US EXPELS RUSSIAN DIPLOMATS] Secretary of State Marco Rubio called the actions "unacceptable violations of diplomatic protocol." The Russian embassy denied any wrongdoing, describing the accusations as "baseless propaganda." [B-ROLL: State Department building, diplomatic vehicles departing] Moscow has promised reciprocal measures. More on this developing story after the break.
broll_descriptions: State Department building, diplomatic vehicles departing

data.script: The Department of Defense has launched a formal investigation into security breaches at three military research facilities in Virginia. Pentagon officials confirmed classified drone technology blueprints were accessed without authorization at installations near Norfolk over the past six months. [CHYRON: DOD PROBES VIRGINIA SECURITY BREACHES] [B-ROLL: Military base entrance gates, security personnel] Defense contractor Apex Technologies denies involvement despite having maintenance contracts at all three sites. Congressional oversight hearings are expected within weeks. More on this developing story tonight.
broll_descriptions: Military base entrance gates, security personnel

data.script: The Department of Defense has launched a formal investigation into allegations that classified satellite imagery was leaked from Vandenberg Space Force Base in California. Pentagon spokesperson Colonel Richard Hayes confirmed that three contractors had their security clearances suspended pending the probe. [CHYRON: DOD INVESTIGATES SATELLITE DATA LEAK] [B-ROLL: Vandenberg Space Force Base entrance, military personnel at security checkpoint] The leaked materials reportedly contain reconnaissance data from overseas operations. Congressional oversight hearings could begin next month. More details ahead.
broll_descriptions: Vandenberg Space Force Base entrance, military personnel at security checkpoint

data.script: The Department of Health and Human Services has launched a criminal investigation into allegations that Meridian Clinical Research falsified data in over forty FDA drug trials spanning three years. [CHYRON: HHS PROBES CLINICAL RESEARCH FRAUD] Sources tell TNN that fabricated patient records may have compromised the approval process for six medications currently on the market. [B-ROLL: Meridian Clinical Research building in Bellhaven, Virginia] FDA Commissioner Sarah Chen called the scope "deeply troubling" and promised swift action. More developments expected tomorrow.
broll_descriptions: Meridian Clinical Research building in Bellhaven, Virginia

data.script: The Department of Justice has launched a criminal investigation into alleged voter registration irregularities in three Pennsylvania counties ahead of next year's elections. Federal prosecutors in Philadelphia issued subpoenas to election officials in Lancaster, Chester, and Delaware counties after discovering what sources describe as systematic attempts to submit fraudulent applications. [CHYRON: DOJ PROBES PA VOTER REGISTRATION FRAUD] [B-ROLL: Federal courthouse in Philadelphia, voters at polling stations] Pennsylvania Secretary of State Michael Harrison called the allegations deeply concerning and promised full cooperation with federal investigators. More details expected tomorrow.
chyrons: DOJ PROBES PA VOTER REGISTRATION FRAUD
broll_descriptions: Federal courthouse in Philadelphia, voters at polling stations

data.script: Federal prosecutors in Chicago have charged former NASA contractor Richard Kellerman with selling classified satellite technology to foreign buyers through encrypted channels. The Justice Department alleges Kellerman accessed restricted propulsion data while working at the Johnson Space Center and sold blueprints for eighteen million dollars. [CHYRON: NASA CONTRACTOR CHARGED WITH ESPIONAGE] [B-ROLL: FBI agents carrying boxes from suburban office building] FBI agents raided his Naperville home yesterday, seizing computers and financial records. Kellerman faces up to twenty years if convicted. More developments expected tomorrow.
broll_descriptions: FBI agents carrying boxes from suburban office building

data.script: The Department of Energy has launched a criminal investigation into alleged there is three major solar panel manufacturers, following a whistleblower complaint filed last month. DOE Inspector General Rebecca Torres confirmed federal agents executed search warrants at facilities in Phoenix and Sacramento yesterday. [CHYRON: DOE INVESTIGATES SOLAR PANEL BID-RIGGING] [B-ROLL: Solar panel manufacturing facility, federal agents carrying boxes] The probe centers on contracts worth nearly eight hundred million dollars in federal clean energy subsidies. More details ahead after this break.
broll_descriptions: Solar panel manufacturing facility, federal agents carrying boxes

data.script: Federal investigators have seized computers and financial records from the headquarters of Consolidated Rail Associates following allegations of safety violations across four states. The FBI raid in Minneapolis targeted the freight company's maintenance division after whistleblowers claimed falsified inspection reports. [CHYRON: FBI RAIDS RAIL COMPANY HQ] [B-ROLL: FBI agents carrying boxes from office building] Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg called the allegations deeply troubling. Company CEO Marcus Delacroix denies any wrongdoing. More developments expected tomorrow.
broll_descriptions: FBI agents carrying boxes from office building
